description: It does everything it says.
really good app.
Use with the MConnect extension for GNOME Shell

Find it hard to live without this when I'm slumming it on other OSes. Makes keeping up with your phone a doddle without having to constantly look at it. The remote keyboard and touchpad feature is awesome for presentations!
while using remote input as Mouse, the cursor image does not move at all. fix it soon... difficult to live without this app

This is the first time I have ever browsed files on my phone without needing to plug it in via a USB cable! That feature alone is worth using Connect, but the other integrations between my KDE desktop and my phone push this over the top! If not for a few bugs, this app would get 5 stars!

Using my phone as a remote when my laptop is plugged to the TV is very handy. Transferring files is seamless. "Find my phone" is a bit unreliable, as the phone sometimes cuts the connection after not being used for while. Notifications synchronisation doesn't always work when using via KDE Connect Indicator, but it works perfectly on KDE Plasma. Answering notifications from my PC is awesome. 

Wishlist:
- some default commands on execute command so more people knew the shenianigans you can do with it. I always set up a "lock screen" command and an open terminal one and that plus keyboard input let's me do almost everything,
- the Bluetooth backend would be nice as my university refuses to open the ports KDE Connect needs on it's internal network, so I only really get to use it at home.
summary: Killer feature for showing off Linux

description: Sometimes it stops when I'm sending files but overall is a pretty useful application

it just WOW! Why Microsoft always have to make things complicated, when if she use andlive with KDE CONNECT, we understand who rules! When my movie went on pause, KDE been faster then my android, and when my ''mom'' XD! hang out movie start again, seem simply, but that was the little + that always impress someone! I give 10/10.. oh and the ''find my phone'' like on old landline wreless telephone, THANK YOU, especialy when it is not under your pillow where it usualy always hide!
Such a useful tool. Works reliably and consistently. Does what it says. Can't ask for more
amazing utility. very useful and customizable.
on windows 10 you have to pay for pro version to remote control for ex. powerpoint
Add Screencast and Bluetooth support please
Many useful features: sending/browsing files, shared clipboard, media controls, shared notifications, ... Not super reliable, though, in part also due to obstacles of the Android platform.
summary: Great way to connect android device with Linux desktop

description: It works great! I have not found any bugs so far. Thanks KDE!

I literally can't do without it nowadays. 
From controlling my laptop with the phone as a mouse,
 using the phone as a remote when playing music,
herbanating my laptop and other custom commands, 
to finding my phone when misplaced 
and sharing Files and Notifications between ALL my devices.
And Hey! Automatically pausing music/videos on all your devices when a call comes in is Magical. :-)
One of the most useful apps on my computer.
Very neat integeation and working out of the box with my lg g6
summary: Working out of the box... Wooow I'm impressed!

description: It is really a great app !! starts working right out of the box !! Love it !

One of the most useful apps I use at home.
IMHO the only feature it lacks is system volume control.
Easy to use and reliable, far better than trying other methods to transfer data.

It does just what it says, extremely convenient.

KDE connect is amazing. It delivers even more feautures that Apple Continuity just over wifi. Universal clipboard,open links on devices, shutdown, lock, unlock computer from an Android device, this is greate!
This is amazing. Not sure why i never realised i needed this sooner.

description: A life changing app.

Someone should say it only keeps working if you add a permenet rule on the firewall. Also everytime the android client gets killed by the phone going to sleep ir looses the connection. Let's you remotely control a presentation or use tour phone as a touchpad to control your desktop!

description: Super buggy. Crashed multiple times. When I select 'browse files' it opens VSCode. App icons missing. SMS function crashed.

Amazingly enough the windows version works just fine on windows. But some how they managed to not have the linux version working, even though it comes from KDE. I love the application on windows and really wanted it on my linux machine. But currently it doesn't even launch on the 20.04 release of Ubuntu :(

Cannot find a tethered iPhone that dmesg shows.
Cannot find any guidance from the website which seems more interested in complex development than users. 
Very disappointing.
Works no probs.

Not just Android and PC, but with PC to PC, Android to Android, it works in every situation. Once you have discovered the power of this software it's hard to live without it, it's that good. I'd say it's the best piece of software made by KDE Community.

If you are having troubles keep in mind KDE release softwares rapidly and so in order to notice the improvements you have to use a recent version of the app along with the desktop. Go with rolling release distributions like openSUSE Tumbleweed or Arch Linux or Solus or Neon etc. Stable (meaning "not-changing") distributions like Ubuntu will always have older buggy versions in their repositories.
summary: Best thing ever made by KDE Community

description:
What I wanted was the ability to see my text messages coming to my Android phone, which usually is not by my side at home. I was quite pleased to see that I could respond to messages from my laptop. 
Creating a new message from my laptop was not important to me, so I was not dissapointed findig out this app doesn't allow that without a lot of tweaking. My OS is UBUNTU 21.04  64-bit GNOME 3.38.5 Windows System Wayland.

very useful app!

On Linux this is so buggy that sheer frustration is the only state I find myself in. It doesn't see the phone that I want to pair with, then it does, then it disappears again. Entering an IP address as a go around is a nonstarter. I finally decided to remove the software as it provides no utility only to find that the uninstall dialogue button does absolutely nothing. Garbage, sheer garbage. Unless you simply want to roll the dice and hope for the best, steer clear!

description: Alles funktioniert einwandfrei. Die Anwendung ist super, um sein Smartphone mit seinem Computer zu synchronisieren.

mit Android, MacOS, Windows. Dateien, Zwischenablage, Mediensteuerung und vieles mehr ist hier in einer Anwendung integriert.
Muss man haben. Manchmal etwas langsam beim Verbinden oder es muss manuell verbunden werden. Daher nur 4 Sterne.
Very practical tool to integrate smartphones. Unfortunately, the app must always be started manually on the Android smartphone so that it is recognised.
Hab lange eine gute Möglichkeit gesucht verschiedene Dateien vom Handy auf den PC zu schicken. Super umgesetzt
summary: Super Integeration vom Android und Linux PC

description:

-Zugriff von unterwegs.
Es funktioniert bei mir 1a und kann es nur empfehlen.
el celular y la compu tan unidos como hermanitos

Desde el móvil ---> al PC, puedo transferir
Desde el PC -----> al Móvil , no puedo transferir.

¿ No se qué es lo que trae el conflicto ?. 
Si me podéis informar os agradeceré.
summary: Transferencia de archivos. me funciona a medias

description: La mejor aplicación para transferencia de archivos y control remoto que he encontrado, aparte de que es multiplataforma (Android, Linux, Microsoft Windows ), es muy rápida ya que usa el sistema de transferencia inalámbrica WiFi, es muy estable para usarse en las plataformas antes mencionadas, además no ocupa casi nada de espacio de almacenamiento...
Una de las herramientas que más me gusta de KDE. Muy completa y permite todo tipo de interacción con tu Smartphone.
Gran aplicación para pasar archivos de pc a movil y viceversa.
que puedo decir es muy bueno
Controlar el audio que escucho en el móvil (generalmente podcasts) desde el ordenador es comodísimo.
Me daño unas imagenes al pasarlas a la pc
Lo primero que instalo siempre que renuevo mi fedora
Me gusta mucho efectiva, simple, excelente.
Que aplicacion maravillosa!! gracias a los desarrolladores por semejante app

No se mueve el mouse al intentar controlarlo desde el celular. Y la ultima actualizacion esta rota la interfaz! Solucionenlo porfavor!

description:
difficile de s'en passer, bien pratique pour relier, simplement et de maniere plutot complete, son gsm android à l'ordi
les +: sms gerés depuis l'ordi, partage presse papier, gestion multimedia, et j'en passe

Excellent logiciel, pratique et souple. Il s'améliore de mois en mois. La partage de fichier est simple et rapide. L'utilisation du téléphone comme souris fonctionne parfaitement.

Excellent software, convenient and flexible. It improves from month to month. File sharing is simple and fast. The use of the phone as a mouse works perfectly.

KDE Connect est juste un incontournable lorsqu'on est sous Linux ! Je n'ai encore jamais vu d'outil aussi complet même chez les GAFA ! À savoir que Microsoft est en train de créer un outil semblable mais qui est jusqu'à maintenant très limité.... La seule chose que je puisse reprocher est que l'adaptation pour Windows qui devient vraiment nécessaire n'est pas très stable...
Sert a crée une liaison entre le pc et le téléphone
Tout fonctionne incroyablement bien ! Rien à redire
et le presse-papier deviens partagé entre l'ordinateur et le téléphone mobile !
Super application qui permet de relier de facon très intelligente son smartphone et son ordinateur ubuntu

Si la connexion entre smartphone et PC fonctionne généralement bien, le transfert de fichiers entre PC pose problème, le transfert semble démarrer mais n'aboutit jamais. Une réinstallation n'a pas résolu le problème et je ne trouve pas d'éléments pour résoudre le problème.
